data.title: Hot, fast, lots of food
data.text: It's not a classy place,  but they are fast and is always fresh and hot.  It's not the best Chinese food in town,  but is a good place to get take out for lunch downtown.  We don't eat in because it's not very nice in there.  We always get it to go.  Probably eat there 3-4 times per month. Fast & cheap.

data.title: always fast
data.text: double dragon is always fast and hot and always plentiful, get at least 2 lunch meals out of my order

data.title: Great Chinese Carry Out
data.text: This is not the kind of place you want to eat in and the decor leaves a lot to be desired.  But the food is the best in the city and very reasonably priced.  We drive all the way downtown just to get some.

data.title: Not bad
data.text: The orange chicken was pretty good. A friend had the pineapple chicken and that wasn't that good. Smaller downtown location. Seems that take out was more popular.

data.title: So many great food choices
data.text: While walking downtown Fort Wayne my husband and I found this little gem.  We picked up a menu and ordered later that week.  The massive menu gave both of us many delicious choices.  We found the "dinner combination" our best value.  Don't miss the crab rangoon; sweet and crispy! The best I've had in years.

data.title: Downtown Fort Wayne Chinese
data.text:
Double Dragon in centrally located in the heart of Fort Wayne Downtown district. It is a very small restaurant that has reasonably priced Chinese food. Great downtown location but metered parking so don't get ticketed and good luck finding a parking spot! EEK! Walking is the way to go! Unless you have your co-worker circle the block while you dash-in! LOL! 

My favorite is their lunch menu. The pricing is around $5-$6.00. The food is cooked to order, I always order the L4-Kung Pao Chicken extra spicy with sweet & sour soup for $4.95. The portion is large for lunch. I can never eat the entire Styrofoam box. The soup is thick and hearty. 

I would recommend this Chinese restaurant!

data.title: Best Chinese Restaurant, Hands Down
data.text: I always look forward to the days in which myself and my coworkers take a nice stroll down to Double Dragon.  Not the most attractive destination however the staff and food make up for the lack of outside appeal.  You open the door and you feel the ambiance flow.  Authentic Chinese dialect and the smell of delectable menu items take over your senses and you get as excited as a kid at 7 am on Christmas morning!  You place your order with what I presume to be the son of the owners who are feverishly working in the back to produce these fine meals.  He is always happy to help and very efficient in taking orders which are never messed up.  I always order my personal favorite of the General Tso Chicken (extra spicy) with Hot & Sour soup.  The portion size is enough to fill the biggest appetites!  The meal just seems to disappear even though I know the amount of food I am consuming is not healthy to eat in such a short period of time.  I finish off with a fortune cookie and leave happier than ever.  Double Dragon (aka Double D's) is by far the best chinese restaurant I have been too.  The value that you receive for the price is amazing and I would recommend to everyone who has an appreciation for Chinese cuisine as well as supporting your hometown restaurants.

data.title: Great for Lunch or Takeout
data.text: Double Dragon is not an attractive restaurant by any stretch of the imagination, but if you are looking for reasonably priced Chinese food for lunch it is pretty good.  The décor is late '70's/early '80's fast food with orange and white booths.  Food is cooked fresh to order and can be served spicy if desired.  Most lunch entrées are large and around $5 which includes soup.  In the winter the drafty door can be unpleasant so carry-out if possible.  My personal favorite is Princess Chicken which is prepared with lots of chicken, vegetables, and a spicy sauce.  Unless you specify steamed rice, it will come with a large portion of fried rice plus either hot and sour or egg drop soup.  The soups have good flavor but are a little heavy on the corn starch thickener.  The restaurant is convenient walking distance from hotels, the convention center, library, and ballpark.

data.title: Not a great value
data.text: I definitely will not return to this establishment.  There wasn't enough food for the price.  I have been to other Chinese restaurants and the value and food is MUCH better

data.title: Go to for asian food
data.text:
I have been going here for years.  The restaurant itself is kind of a dump. It can be cold in the lobby in the winter time.  There are always boxes and cardboard in the seating area towards the back of the store.  I can not recall every seeing any work being done to improve the inside.
   Okay with that being the said you can always get some very hot and tasty food.  The prices are comparable to other Asian restaurants in the area.  The employees do carry a very heavy accent which can make it difficult to order.  I have tried most everything on the menu and have never had a real complaint.

data.title: Very average Chinese take-out.
data.text:
I ordered a pork dish with chinese vegetable. The pork ended up being dry and there were no Chinese vegetables. There were some other vegetables but that's not what i expected or paid for.
Everything was smothered in a sweet and oily sauce that I didn't care for much.
The prices are ok, you definitely get full from the main course size, it's probably enough for 2 but this was probably one of the worst Chinese meals I've had.
The eggroll was inedible.

data.title: POCA HIGIENE
data.text: La limpieza del local, deja bastante que desear, así como los ingredientes que cocinan. De hecho, fui a recoger el pedido que había encardado mi novia por teléfono, y fuimos incapaces de probar bocado. Cuando se observa que el cocinero se rasca la cabeza (sin gorro) sobre el wok mientras cocina, se contempla a una cucaracha de gran tamaño como se pasea tranquilamente junto a los alimentos, se comprueba que el arroz frito puede ser usado para tapar agujeros de la pared, y cuando el cerdo agridulce era masas de olor y textura extrañas flotando en una salsa casi líquida, por mucho hambre que puedas tener, este desaparece al instante Justificable probar su comida, únicamente si existe riesgo inminente de fallecer por inanición.
